Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Costanza”
Reviews.Author: K L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room (and hotel generally) were clean, towels changed every day and sheets changed after 2 days. Comfortable beds, first night was difficult to get to sleep because of a rowdy party of schoolkids who were staying, however they left the following day and from then on it was very quiet at night. Breakfast fine for standard of hotel. Hotel quite a way from centre of Rome, but only a couple of blocks from Bologna Metro station, so easy to access centre, also plenty of buses from Nomentana (main road).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with wonderful local restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn C
Reviews.Content: Santa Costanza is clean and comfortable. The room was small and the breakfast basi, but we didn't expect anything more at this price. It was a ten minute walk to the underground station but from there all of Rome was easily accessible. Almost opposite is a supermarket and just round the next corner was a fabulous restaurant called `La Casetta'. Never have we been to a better eating place. The food was spectacular, the prices low and the family that ran it welcomed us like long lost cousins. It was so good that we ate there every night. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lizzysbiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in good order, well decorated and excellent value for a budget trip to Rome. I was on a girls break and stayed 4 nights. The first room was small so we asked Emmanuelle at reception for a better room and he moved us immediately to a 3 bed spacious room at the rear of the hotel. We requested extra towels & pillows and everything appeared straight away, they could'nt do enough for us. Quality of towels, linens very good, toiletries, bidet, well stocked fridge, all excellent. Always had hot water, hairdryer, a/c etc. Free internet but via a code on a printed receipt from reception which expires every 24 hrs which is a tad annoying. Coffee at breakfast is terrible, breakfast is cold continental buffet / no eggs, great pastries, croissants. Local Tabachi kiosk and Carrefour supermarket 5 mins walk, bus stops on Nomentana Street very assessible to everything so did'nt use the tube. Return journeys from central Rome after a day's sightseeing or night out were done by taxi and we split it 4 ways so was very cheap, on average 2-3 euro per person so well worth the time saved on waiting for a bus. TOP TIP REMEMBER TO WEAR TRAINERS OR SPECIALIST WALKING SHOES!!. My heart goes out to Emmanuelle who looked after us admirably he deserves a medal from Loan hotel group. Try the Cotton Club (jazz club) near the hotel and a great pizza pasta traditional cucina also closeby. Very enjoyable trip would recommend this hotel only if you don't want to be in the centre of the City (you still have traffic noise at Santa Costanza). If you want to be close to Vatican, Trevi etc. don't bother with Santa Costanza.

Reviews.Title: “Be carefull when you have booked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked by us via a travel agent. After our flight of 3 hours and the bustrip we arrived at the hotel. We were very disappointed that we were told to be moved to a 'sister' hotel nearer the Vatican because of a need for rooms from a special ambassy in Rome. More travellers were experiencing the same and we were moved to that hotel in the middle of nowhere for us as Roma tourists. That hotel was in no way near the vatican and as well far away from any public subway (only a bus transport downtown possible). We also heard other reasons were told for moving to other travellers, for instance the water supply was suddenly not good anymore at Constanza. For us this hotel is not even worth to get any grade, because fooling the tourist is the worst you can do.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: ARG5
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Rome recently and I booked this hotel for our stay. The staff were very polite and knowledgeable about the local area and transport links. Breakfast was very well stocked and a great start to the day, The rooms were spacious, showers were hot and the rooms were of a decent temperature. The only down side was that you could here alot during the night. The walls are quite thin and you can hear people in the corridor, All in all this is an excellent choice and a great base for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, value for money and well connected”
Reviews.Author: shremu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Costanza was not my first choice when i wanted to book in rome but it certainly was not a bad choice. It is a simple hotel located in a quiet neighborhood of rome, well connected but still a bit off-centre. Location : The hotel is located a few bus stops away from the train station of rome and is not exactly city-centre. However it is very well connected with the super dense transportation system of rome. There are a bunch of buses(public transport) which leave from right outside the hotel and a couple of them stop almost right at the hotel doorstep.Some are the superfast ones which take you to Roma-termini in 5 min tops. I think this more than compensates for its location bit far from the city centre.It is located in a very quiet residential neighborhood which seems a bit upmarket. I saw a couple of foriegn embassies when i took a stroll around the hotel. There is a supermarket right across the street from the hotel which is an added advantage ( for some). It is not located close to ANY of the sights but the buses next to the hotel take you almost anywhere in rome including to the vatican. Hotel and rooms : The hotel is not the most posh and well maintained hotel one can find but this needs to be co-related to the price you are paying. The rooms are well kept but are not very recently renovated. The bathroom is quite spacious but i found the shower cubicle tiny. The decor is kinda old and due to the wooden steps and lobbies,one can hear faintly the footsteps of people in the hallways or stairs.The carpeting is also old and holds the cigarette smell so kinda smells smoky most of the times.Some rooms windows open out on the street which isnt very busy and also the window blocks out all the noise if any.The TV was not the latest and basic at best...but again, its what you pay for.All and all not at all a BAD room to stay in but definitely could do with improvements. Staff and service : the hotel staff was very polite and helpful. The guy running the night shift when we arrived was very friendly but i couldn't say the same about the lady or other guy in the morning shift. They were not rude but not very friendly either. The friendly receptionist helped and guided us a lot with bus routes and sights to see.The staff at breakfast was not as prompt as one would want and only turned up when a refill was seriously needed. The housekeeping staff was ok but they forgot to replace the towels in my room but did so when asked for later.Check-in Check out was also effortless. We checked in really later : 2 AM in the morning and a special mention for the friendly receptionist..coz he was as cheerful and accommodating..as one would want..after a ryanair flight and long taxi wait and taxi ride. Breakfast: The breakfast is the usual European bfast with cold meat, lots of rolls and buns and 2-3 types of bread, cereal, cereal bars, rusk, jams, marmalade, nutella and likes.Very well stocked to be honest. The Coffee and tea was good too and only slight downside was that it was not supervised very well coz although we got our coffee refills in time, the bread rolls or milk were not replenished untill couple of people were standing there waiting. Other : there is a very nice restaurant down the road ( away from the bus stop) and couple of good cafes and bars as well...Decent lunch or dinner places for sure ! In conclusion : this is a nice hotel if you are either too late to book ( last min booking) or on a tight budget. Everything is decent but nothing memorable. This would be my back-up hotel if i dont find anything in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Stephen T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Some rooms were a bit small but had everything you needed in them. My room was very warm and I had to keep opening the window to cool it down. My room was very clean and tidy and the staff removed any empty bottles I left in the room, which I thought was very good. The location was good, fairly close to the metro and there are some good restaurants around and a supermarket just down the road. Breakfast was different to what I'm use to but still very nice. Overall a good hotel and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: Josie H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a tour package so we didn't have a say in this. Our first impression with the staff was when the taxi driver (who was trying to rip us off) started complaining about us to the reception staff in Italian when we were next to him. The receptionist was unsympathetic and also contributed to the conversation in Italian. Nothing improved when we went to our room which stunk of cigarettes. The receptionist insisted that this was a non-smoking establishment. The breakfast is also terrible with croissants being the only edible thing. While we had to stay there multiple times due to the tour package, they always insist on taking our room key every time you leave the hotel, even if you say you're going round the corner to get a coffee. They insist! Which gave them the name 'Hotel Gestapo' while we were staying there. I also had a friend who needed to crash for a couple of hours in the afternoon while she waited for a flight. For her to be allowed into the hotel, the insisted on keeping her passport and were really really rude about it. The location isn't great either as only one bus goes to the city and the train station is ages away. Not too many food choices too but there is a supermarket 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs if you want to stay there”
Reviews.Author: nicky g
Reviews.Content: We just come back from Santa Constanza hotel, Reception: They do not speak english. There was a strike in rome and we were trying to get information in order to go to the airport, nobody could give us an answer, They never smile, they do not will to help you. Room: Clean, good bed, good bathroom, Breakfast:It was fine, there was coffe, break, sweets, etc. Distance from the center: Its a little far because you need to walk 10 minutes to bologna station and after that to take the metro. This can be good and bad, depending what you want. Its a cheap hotel with lack of things that more expensive hotels have. You can leave with this, me, personally all these things that I mentioned before didnt affect me , because I just needed a cheap hotel to sleep after being all day in the center of rome. What destroyed everything were THE HORRIBLE WALLS IN THE HOTEL. The walls are not concrete, are something like a very slim wood so, if your neighbor speaks just a little, you hear it like if he is doing it in your ears. My and my husband, we suffered very much on this because we arrive always very tired after walking all day and we couldnt sleep because our neighboor was watching tv until late, and he is right because he didnt have it that high, but because of the walls are so bad, it was simply a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: haggag
Reviews.Content: Clean room ,friendly reception ,good loction close to metro station bologna ,amazing Rome full by egpytian obelisk it's nice to see our monuments but should be by respect . Vatican big musem out of holy feeling a lot of Tourest not prayer with big manager . Nice time happy 5 days full by nice surprise .

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate hotel for such a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaInWonderlandx
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Hotel Santa Costanza for 4 nights in June and had a wonderful time; I would start my review with saying that I would definitely recommend this hotel, it was excellent value for money and provided us with every thing that we needed which was a comfortable bed, clean bathroom and an adequate breakfast. We didn't need luxury for our stay in Rome as we were out of the room for the entire day and only came back to sleep, bathe and eat! The location of the hotel was also pretty good, it's a 10 minute walk to get to the nearest metro although they do appear to be building one that is much closer than that (not sure when that will be finished though!) it's then very easy to get into central Rome on the metro as there is only two lines (A and B). The service was acceptable, every one we encountered spoke English and was well mannered although they weren't overly friendly however, this really didn't concern us. As for the breakfast, it was acceptable, I would have preferred more of a variety e.g. toast, fresh fruit, muffins, a cooked breakfast would also have been lovely but I completely understand that for the price and being in Italy a continental breakfast is pretty standard! Positives: Excellent value for money, Good location, Good air conditioning, Nice balcony, Perfectly comfortable and acceptable bed, TV. Negatives: Shower in our particular room was difficult to use as it seemed to cascade over your head and I constantly felt like I was drowning and this in turn made the floor become soaking wet which we had to mop up with our towels, Could have had a slightly better breakfast selection, Staff could have been friendlier, There also could have been more pillows in the room as the ones provided were very flat and I definitely needed another one. I would end my review by saying that if you are looking to go to Rome and have a fantastic time sight seeing, eating at wonderful restaurants and soaking up the Italian culture on a budget then this is the hotel for you whereas if you are looking for a little bit of luxury and don't have to watch the pennies then go for a better hotel in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: dellya
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean rooms and helpful personell. We've stayed there for 5 night and it was a good choise ... a starting point to visit Rome, as we left the hotel every morning after breakfast and returned late at night, only to sleep. You could arrive in the center of Rome in max. 30 minutes ... it was close to the metro station (10 minutes walk) and the bus station was exactly in front of the hotel. Italian style breakfast, with sweet pastry and coffee, one type of cheese / ham, yogurt, milk and cereals, but good enough for me. You can ask for an espresso if you like, with no extra charge. I would have no problem in returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned in a nice way”
Reviews.Author: Patsy0075
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in July 2011. The hotel is located approx. 15, min.from the center if you take one of the express busses from around the corner. Take either bus 60 to Piaza Venezia or bus 90 to Termini st. The hotel itself is kind of old fashioned in a nice way. The breakfast was O.K but not the most varied. Stil, a nice, clean and quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: Tindarosa
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in the heart of Rome. I stayed here twice. The first time I got a fabulous room that was very comfortable. I was traveling alone and got a nice double bed. The second time I stayed there, they gave a closet with a view of the cement wall next door & a cot to sleep on. The staff treats you according to the tips you give out. It's very close to a grocery store, park & buffet restaurant. It also has an elevator, which is uncommon in alot of hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clive o
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre but on bus routes to all paces of interest which could be reached within 10-15 minutes. Will definitely use this hotel again when we return to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: LichfieldSteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Costanza and it did what it says on the tin. Our room was clean and well appointed although we have stayed in bigger rooms. In our few dealings with the staff we found them to nothing less than helpful and professional. Its location was good - three stops on the Metro to the city centre and buses passing by the door - we bought 3-day tickets for €11 which provided unlimited travel on the Metro, buses and trams - which was useful as there are not too many reasonable restaurants close by. If scoring I would probably give 9 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the photos”
Reviews.Author: Terry2090
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend stay in this hotel, hotel room was one of the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in, not at all like the photos, no balcony and just the smallest of windows. On arrival it was extremely hot and I could not get the a/c to work, went to reception for assistance but was informed that as it was a dual system they could not set the a/c at this time of year as the authorities monitor the energy bills and they could be fined, didn't prevent the a/c working in Reception though. The bathroom was so small that the toilet could only be used by sitting at an angle, also to gain entrance to the shower one had to be a bit of a contortionist, smallest shower cubicle I have ever come across.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for price”
Reviews.Author: Pineguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week and had no real problems with our accommodations. The breakfast was the same every day and the guy running it never smiled and seemed to get upset if anything was disturbed on the table. Not the face you want to see first thing in the morning. No interaction with guests at all. Our room was OK but the bathroom was better: big and clean. The hotel is conveniently located to catch a frequent bus to Termini along Nomentana. We took this bus from Termini when we arrived. There is a metro but it's a 15 min walk away. We had to leave early (before bus service started ) and had the hotel call a cab to get us to the Rome Tiburtina Metro/Train that went straight to the Leonardo da Vinci Airport. It was a 10 minute cab ride from the hotel and probably the best way (in reverse) to get to the hotel. If you're there for a week, get the weekly bus pass. It's good for unlimited rides on buses and the metro. ATM located a short distance away on corner closest to the hotel at Nomentana and Aprile. Never ate at any of the nearby restaurants. There is a grocery about 3 blocks down Aprile on the opposite side of the street.

Reviews.Title: “at this hotel we found PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: ella086
Reviews.Content: We had reservation at this hotel for April 2010, but due the vulcano's ash, we never arrived at this hotel. They understood the situation and they returned us all the money. No excusses, no problems. In a word full of money sharks, at this hotel we found PEOPLE.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cheap and great if your not fussy”
Reviews.Author: ezdmanx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights. Got the room for €74 a night (from www.hotels.com) which is very cheap for Rome! Location is not bad either. A bus stop nearby takes you in and out of Rome center. If you're not fussy and on a tight budget you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Scuscores
Reviews.Content: Nice and compact hotel with a very polished serving staff both at the reception and the restraunt bar. The lift is slightly old but not creaky! The variety in food served leaves a lot to be desired, but there are good options like an Italian and Chinese joint bang opposite the road, so this can be managed. Also a huge supermarket is situated just 2 mins walk away for any misc. needs. Locationwise, it is fantastic, so easily accessible by both busses and trams to all parts of Rome. So, ideal location for sightseeing and long staying travellers. All in all, thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel for a long weekend in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: esptraveller1
Reviews.Content: Even though it is not right in the centre, it is relly easy to get everywhere with public transport. The bus stop is just round the corner and the Metro is just 10 min walk away. I would recommend to have the day pass (4€) which gives you unlimited travel all day. The area is decent (not rough like around Termini station) and fairly quiet at night (for Rome, anyway). There is stil quite a lot of traffic noise but as there is air conditioning in the room, you can just shut the window. Most of the staff are very pleasant and helpful, the room (we had a twin) is big enough and clean. Breakfast is nothing to shout about but quite adequate. Overall my mum and I had a fantastic time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: Anna73784
Reviews.Content: This was the first Hotel that my sister and i stayed at in Rome. We were only there for about three days all up (so not a very long time). The best thing about the place was the staff, they were nice and helpfull which is what you need the most when you are travelling. The rooms were fine and the bathrooms were about average. The lift like many of the Hotels in Europe was small, so you either have to be patient or go up and down the stairs, i didnt mind but i guess some people would. The location wasn't the best but it meant that it was closer to the parts of Rome that other tourists wouldn't see, and we went to a really nice restaurant that we definitely wouldn't have gone to otherwise. Oh and the breakfast was pretty good too. I didn't book the hotel myself because it was part of a tour (i did rate it average because i thought that would be fair), but thats not to say that i wouldn't go back. And the only reason i wouldnt recommend it to a friend is because it wasn't fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Rosegod82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel a few years ago now (although it feels like only yesterday). Our first observation was that it was a bit further from the metro station than advertised, it was a good 10 minute walk at a fairly brisk pace, fine for us as a young (ish) fit & healthy couple but for anyone with kids or the elderly it might be a bit of an issue. That said its really easy to find the metro station from the hotel (or vice versa) and the metro is a fantastically convenient way to get around the city. The room wasnt exactly spacious but very comfy and clean and nice decorated. We only ever ate breakfast in the hotel so we cant really comment on food but breakfast was perfectly adequate. Our only (small) complaint was that the room was very warm and the only way to cool it down was to open the window which let in a lot of road noise, other than that we had a great stay and would recommend the Santa Constanza to anyone looking for a good value place to stay in the most beautiful city in the world. (On a personal note we got engaged during our stay in Rome, it was the perfect setting for such a romantic break)

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: melly1980
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santa Costanza is in the outskirt of the citycenter of Rome. It`s very cute and i liked the design. Breakfast was nothing special but enough for a good start in the day. The room was overheated but the staff made sure that we can move to a cooler room to be comfortable. I liked it and would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, not a bad location if you know the transit system”
Reviews.Author: m0bius
Reviews.Content: The staff seemed friendly, and our room was clean and quiet despite being on the corner of the building next to a busy street. I don't recall there being a breakfast of any kind, but then again I don't remember looking for one as I was on a tourist schedule. :) At first the hotel seemed too far away from public transit, but then I noticed there's a bus stop right outside the building! It's just a short hop to the Bologna metro station, then off to il centro. The only negatives: 1) There's not much in the neighborhood for dining or shopping. 2) At their normal booking price, you'd be better off closer to downtown if that's going to be your daily destination. I got a hefty discount through a hotel booking site, which I would highly recommend if you want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: mongooze
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a quiet area 15 mins by bus (stop at the corner) from city center and 500 meters to subway station ... staff very friendly and helpful.... breakfast was always fresh and abundant and the cappuccino was great.... Room was very clean and kept well by housekeeping, internet available for a small fee... inexpensive coffee and lunch next door at the Chill Out Cafe, All night cappuccino available at the Gastronomi on the corner very nice local resturant for dinner 200 meters away called Hostaria Al Monumento great food and friendly staff (ask for house wine 5 eu) Great hotel,great location, great price would be happy to stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you get the right room, but not a central location.”
Reviews.Author: kazakas
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Rome Termini station at about 10pm, and we followed advice from other travellers by getting the bus to the hotel. There are several buses, but it can be a bit hard to judge where to get off the bus as some are express buses and others stop at every stop. Once we found the right stop, the hotel is a few metres from the bus stop, which is very convenient. It was easy and quick to check in. We were put in a room on the 6th floor - the lift only goes up to the fifth floor, but that didn't really bother us. The room was more of an issue - it was a narrow attic room, which was really hot and only had a small sloping window we couldn't even see out of. I had read another review on this website of someone put into a similar room, who asked to move. So we decided to ask if we could move rooms, which is the first time we had ever done that. It was late by this stage. The staff said nothing was available for that night, but they would try to move us the next day, which to their credit they did. We ended up with a nice room on the 3rd floor with a balcony. The rooms aren't large, but were nice and had everything we needed, including a small fridge, which was handy for keeping food for lunch in. Beds were comfortable, but would have been nice to have extra pillows. TV didn't have many english channels (except BBC world news), but we didn't really expect that. Breakfast is self service and was fine. Lots of choice. The only thing we didn't really like was the 'fruit juice', which was more like squash/cordial. The staff were all courteous and friendly. There is a large supermarket less than 5 minutes walk away and a tobacconists over the road which sells metro/bus tickets (1 euro for one bus trip, 4 euros for a day, or 11 euros for 3 days). We ate a local pizzeria restaurant one evening, which was very good. One of our travel guides had a bus map, so we used the buses all over the city. It does take longer than you think to get from one side of the city to the other, but there is a bus from the hotel that goes to the Collesseum and one from just down the road that goes straight to the Vatican. One thing we were sorry to miss were the catacombes, which are literally over the road from the hotel. They were shut for a month when we were there. If you travel from the nearest metro station (Bologna) and go one stop to Tiburtina train station, you can get a train to Tivoli (1 hour journey - about 2.20 euros return!). Also, we saw a much cheaper train to the airport (something like 3 euros instead of the direct trains costing 11 euros from termini). The train anouncements leave something to be desired - oh, and you must stamp your ticket in the platform machine before you get on the train! Best to leave lots of time if you are not familiar with Italian trains. All in all, we had a great time in Rome, and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel, clean but location not the best”
Reviews.Author: sandybenj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in august 2009. The hotel is at least 15 minute walk from the Bologna metro stop (however there appears to be another metro station being built 2 minutes away from the hotel). The hotel was clean and good value for the price. The room was spacious, air conditioning was great and the windows had shutters to shield from the early morning sun.Breakfeast was included and was a buffet style. The food was ok but was the same every morning, at the weekend the breakfeast was poor and the bread they had was stale. The hotel is in a quiet part of town.There is a restaurant across the road past the crossroads, do not eat here, it was incrediblly expensive and the staff were the rudest we have ever encountered.There is a supermarket nearby which was handy.

Reviews.Title: “Broom-closet room; mgmt full of excuses”
Reviews.Author: dtkim80
Reviews.Content: First off, I booked this room through Hotwire, my first time booking a hotel through them. They promised a brand name hotel, comparing the 3 stars with Hilton, DoubleTree, etc. I don't know what their definition of "brand-name" is, but it doesn't match mine. I checked in, and the guy spoke English pretty well, and it was fast. This hotel has a standard metal key on a very heavy key fob. I looked around and they have a pretty expansive living room-like lobby, brightly lit, with plenty of couches and a small and expensive bar in the corner. I never saw anyone there, so as a social watering-hole, it's a no. There's also one computer station connected to the internet for tenant use. They also have 24 hour access cards to their WiFi. I was given my room and when I walked in, I thought I was in Eastern Europe. The room stands approximately 5.5 ft x 11 ft with a twin size bed and dim lighting. It's very cramped. I just have carry-on luggage and it's taking up a lot of real estate. The desk, which is right by the floor-to-ceiling window/door, reminds me of something I had when I was in Fourth Grade. Good thing I have a netbook...it fits perfectly on this desk. They did manage to cram a not-very-well stocked minibar into the room between the foot of the bed and the desk. The wardrobe is on the other side of the window behind the desk. In order to open it, you have to tuck the chair in all the way under the desk. The television is around a 20" screen mounted high on the wall. The remote control doesn't work. The TV is very basic with a bunch of local Italian channels, CNN and BBC in English. I had to reach up to turn it on and change the channels Onto the bathroom. The door to the bathroom only opens halfway before being stopped by the side of the twin bed. The bathroom itself is small, but nicely appointed with marble tile, and complete with a decent sized pedastal sink, toilet, bidet, and stand up shower. The hotel provided one towel and a floor mat towel, two small bars of soap, and a bottle of shampoo. Above the sink, there's a small glass ledge to lay out your hygiene items, enough space for one person's hygiene items. The shower is placed in a corner of the bathroom and has sliding doors...well, it's supposed to have sliding doors. One of the doors was missing, allowing a nice chilly draft into the shower. The water splashes down onto the marble floor and all over the bidet. The drain is also slow. I went to the front desk and told them that my shower was missing a door, as this was the straw that broke the camel's back. The management seemed to have no problem with it and they were dismissive about a missing door on the shower. I told them that water was all over the ground and they said that housekeeping cleans all that. I think they were saying that the door wasn't supposed to be there, which kinda made me feel like they were saying I was dumb. I just kinda waived it off and started writing this review. I think I'll leave, even if I have to give up the money I already paid.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaning staff left our door open..... twice!”
Reviews.Author: Nervytraveler
Reviews.Content: Santa Costanze isn't a terrible hotel. It's clearly a hotel you'd visit when you're on a budget. My girlfriend and I visited the hotel in May of this year. The hotel is some way from the center of Rome (a 15 minute bustrip, and that's only when there are no traffic jams).It took us 1,5 hours to find it because we kept getting wrong directions. From the outside, the hotel is nothing to look at.... and from the inside it's still no palace. But the rooms are well equiped and clean. The beds were nice, the bathroom had a good shower, a comfy toilet, and for some reason a soundsystem that amplified the sound from the tv (presumably so that you could listen to a radio channel whilst showering). Just don't expect a very tasty and satisfying breakfast. The food at this hotel was pretty disgusting. The problems we had were with the staff. Twice in a row, the cleaning staff had left our door open. Not "unlocked open", literally open. When we complained with the staff at the desk, they blamed me for not closing the door properly. The next day it happened again. Both times our hotelroom door had stood open for at least half a day. Luckily, our room was in a small corridor on the groundfloor which almost no-one goes through, since it only leads to 3 rooms. Since the rooms aren't equiped with safes, anyone could've taken our stuff if they'd wanted to. Despite all of this, we had a great time in Rome. But for obvious reasons, I won't be visiting hotel Santa Costanze again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel... but just a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: TUKO666
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in June. The closest metro station is Bologna, which is about 20 minutes walk from the hotel (a bit long) though the hotel is located between 2 main streets, making it easy to grab buses to get to the city center. The room was nice and quiet, with a big bed, air conditioning, a spacious bathroom and a balcony facing the street. A highlight were the electric blinds that allowed complete darkness for a good night sleep! The room had a TV and a mini-bar as well. Good breakfast included in the price. Nice lobby and helpful staff. We would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little annoyed at small problems”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Dani
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my husband & brother. We arrived at the hotel quite late (about 1am) to find that there was a 'small problem' the guy at the front desk advised us that the double room that my husband & I had booked had a problem with the bathroom, but 'thanks to god' that they were booked out....this didn't really make any sense & he kept repeating this over & over. He then told us that there were 2 single rooms we could use for the night...I really just think that they over-booked & since we were the last guest to arrive that we got the short end of the stick & were stuck without a room. They did not offer anything to apologise for this inconvenience & frankly I was too tired to argue. Other that this the stay was ok..the breakfast is not that great (rolls, croissants, 1 type of cheese, ham & yoghurt), the juice was also sickly sweet & only 1 type of tea on offer. The rooms were a decent size with air con (which was great as it was atleast 35 degrees every day). The hotel is about 7-10 mins walk to the metro, has a small supermarket down the road & a larger one just around the corner from Bologna Metro. There are some great little restaurants near by too. All attrations/centre of Rome are a short metro ride away. All in all the hotel was ok, just a little annoyed about the blatent lie upon our arrival & the fact that we were not offered anything because of the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, quiet area, convenient public transport”
Reviews.Author: just_a_jay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in August. Granted, hotel is on the outskirts of town, but there are a numbers of buses (90, 36 etc) from the Termini that stop right outside the hotel (10 min ride). It is literally a 30 second walk to the hotel from the bus stop on Nometana Road. The metro is a bit further away (12-15min walk) but I didnt see the point of taking the metro when there are so many buses outside the hotel. There is a supermarket nearby for replenishing your drinking water supply and snacks. If you walk up Aprile XXI, (5mins) there is a neighbourhood of restaurants, pizzarias and gelatarias around. Prices are affordable (about 7-10 Euro for a meal). Less for takeaway pizzas. The rooms are very clean and charming. There is central airconditioning (thank god. It was 35 degrees in Rome everyday) and breakfast is usually included in the price. For £30+ a night, you cant go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was nince”
Reviews.Author: Levente02
Reviews.Content: We were there for leisure. The hotel was very good located. Using the troley bus was so easy to reach the centre. The room was clean, but a little old fashioned. The breakfast was not the richest, and the front desk also could be nicer. Anyway it was a good stay there, I would recommend for anyone (good value 4 a money also)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: Octavio_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 15 day holiday specifically 'tailored' for us by Citalia, through Thompson. We spent 5 days in Sorrento, 4 in Rome and 5 in Viareggio. Air flights, private car pick-up and first class rail tickets all arranged by 'Citalia and all went without a hitch - a great holiday. About the Hotel Santa Constanza - only B & B accommodation available, but breakfast very adequate, consisting of ham, cheese, bread rolls, quassants, fruit juice and coffee etc. Twin room and en-suite bathroom on first floor was a good size, clean and comfortable, but the wash basin had to be drained slowly or the waste water would rise from the centre drain cover in this 'wet-room' style bathroom. When we first arrived we were given a double bedroom on the 6th floor which was 'smelly', miserable and dark, but as we had booked a twin they swapped us to the 1st floor. Also the lift only goes to the 5th floor - so if at all possible try and avoid the 6th floor. Staff and porters friendly, but I had to ask for the air conditioning to be switched back on when returning in the early evening on 3 days, as all of the air-conditioning in the the hotel is switched off at about 10.30 hrs. Hotel is a good base to explore Rome. Exit the hotel and walk to the right for a about 10 minutes to the Metro station. Metro very easy to use with only two lines of travel. A 4 Euro ticket gives 24 hour use on Metro and buses. Mid-way between hotel and Metro station is a pizza/pasta restaurant with reasonable prices. And across the road a supermarket. Leave the hotel and walk to the left for a few minutes and you will come across a friendly cafe where you can eat sandwiches cakes and beer. Further down the road is a McDonalds. Highlight of our stay was a pre-arranged guided tour of the Vatican/Sistine Chapel. Also went on a guided tour of the Colosseum and Palatine with a local tour operator who approached us as we left the Colosseum Metro station - this was also worthwhile. Food very expensive local to the Vatican so avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean tidy and great location”
Reviews.Author: Tirthankar
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great location and positive staff. 5 to 7 minute by walk from metro station. Very nicely connected to all location. Great experience for me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Located too far fr Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: leo03777
Reviews.Content: Dragging luggages from Metro Station to Hotel was too much. It was more than 1km by walking (20 min with luggages). Front Desk Staff was unfriendly. Room was small but clean. Shower cubicle was incrediblely tiny with only standing space for one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, in quieter location”
Reviews.Author: mlockwood
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. I say "quieter" because no place in Rome can be considered quiet. Rooms have a balcony with table and chairs. We had a great picnic we bought from the nearby grocery on the balcony. Public Transit is very close and frequent. Our only complaint was the AC was still shut off in April and the street noise was a bit loud with the door open for air.

Reviews.Title: “excelent value,lovely and clean,great location for traveling”
Reviews.Author: chrislil
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all we expected,lovely and clean,friendly staff very helpful. Simple but good breakfast.The rooms were spotless but a little noisy by the street but after a day out they were great and all you could ask for . Perfect location for metro and traveling to major tourist spots . On the whole a perfect stay and we would recommend to our friends,we will certainly go there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: Chloebebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, and we love it. Located outside of the city area. Take bus #90 outside of Termini and get off at the 5th stop right outside of the hotel. Metro stop Bologna was only 5-10 mins walk away. Supermarket is half way between the hotel and the Metro. Easy to find a place to eat, and price was cheaper than those in the city. Hotel stuffs were friendly and helpful. Morning buffet was simple but still good. AC worked fine, and only paid 6 euro for 24 hours internet service (very cheap).

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alizhud
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very helpful, friendly staff. We stayed her for 5 nights so we could go sightseeing. We walked everywhere, and found all attractions within easy reach. For those who don't like walking or find it difficult there is the convenience of the Metro nearby. Continental style breakfast which included cereals, fruit and yogurt. Our room was clean and comfortable. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean, good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: London_Girl1980
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Rome for 4 days and stayed in this hotel booked as part of a package from lastminute.com. Had booked a triple room even though there were just two of us (hoping for more space), but was initially given a very narrow room on the 6th floor with 2 single beds and only an attic window. Asked to be moved to somewhere more airy and was given a much nicer room on the 5th floor with a big bed and balcony. Noisy at night and the lift is like stepping into the 50's (can just about squeeze 2 people in there!) but the location is great and staff very helpful. About a 10 minute walk to the metro which takes you to all the sights in Rome. From Leonardo Airport, take the Leonardo Express to Termini (€11) , then get the bus from main bus stand about 5 mins up the road. Buses 36, 90 and 90d take you straight to the hotel, get off at Aprile XX1. Drivers are very helpful and will let you know where to get off. I've never been to Rome before nor am great with directions but the public transport is really simple to use, buses and trains take you everywhere, dont waste money on taxi's! Breakfast is rather basic, cereal and croissants, no dinner service/restaurant and decor needs updating but all in all, good value for money and location/cleansiness makes up for the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for an excellent trip!!”
Reviews.Author: laineybogs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and 2 friends! This hotel was a real find! Rooms were small but that didn't matter as we literally slept in them! Although small they were comfy, warm, and spottlessly clean! Towels and bed linen got changed every day and room cleaned. Only had to put a 10 euro dept down for safety dept boxes in rooms. The hotel staff, Emmanuel in particular were brilliant, their English is amazing and they have great knowledge about Rome and how to get around! The breakfast was your basic continental but was enough for us to stock up with for our busy days ahead! Foyer was lovely, warm and friendly with planety of seating! It is a little out of the centre which we found ideal as it ment it was a bit quieter from the mayhem of Rome. It took 10-15 mins on the bus to get to centre right next to the Colosseum and Emmanuel building! We then brought a 3 day public transport ticket which includes trams, buses and underground. We got this from ticket place right next to Colosseum! Our trip was amazing but it was made all the better by staying here, it was deffinatly value for money and I would recommend it to anyone and be very happy to stay here again! We managed in our trip to see: Emmanuel building(worth paying 7 euros to take glass lift to roof for panoramic views) Colosseum-my favourite place The Vatican- stunning place and worth going to the top of the dome (cupular i think it's called) Bit disapointed that the guards shout at you in sistine chapel and no photos! The Pantheon The Trevi fountain- close fav but even more beautiful at night The Spanish steps- very busy with no flowers like they show in all the photos! Other little gems along the way! The best place I think i've been! Loved Rome, the food, the people, the company and especially the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great area, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Anniebee3
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome on 7th March, stayed at hotel for 2 nights and would recommend it to all. Rooms were small but immaculate with en-suite, mini-bar and cleaned each day. The hotel is in an ideal location for eating out in the evenings to avoid paying the extortionate prices in the city centre. Highly recommend both San Marino Pizzeria restaurants just up the road from hotel. Breakfast fine but beware of the waiter who works so fast that if you leave your table unattended for even 30 seconds it will be cleared before you get back!!! Not a problem though - we thought this was rather funny. Exit hotel, turn left walk up to bus stop or walk into centre in 30 mins, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Santa Constanza - Good hotel near to metro station”
Reviews.Author: jwBristol
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night break at the Hotel Constanza in Rome. The hotel is about ten minutes from the Bolgna Metro Station. The hotel is very clean and the rooms very comfortable - the only complaint would be that the hotel is too warm - apparently the air conditioning is not turned on until June. Also, the hotel is situated on a busy main road which is noisy so you may need ear plugs. Breakfast is OK but not too exciting and not much variation. There is a supermarket conveniently situated across the road and a great restaurant called San Marinos about five to ten minutes walk away - the Hotel will give you directions. Wine and food very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Harvey012
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a good location , not too far from the city centre, staff speak good standard of english and are helpful which is a bonus. Breakfast is okay, nothing too special, the rooms are clean and kept to a good standard. There is a supermarket up the road where you can go and stock up on the necessities (booze). Overall I would return to this hotel as it is located in a very plesant area and easily accessible to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Minigirl0108
Reviews.Content: Perfect Base To View Rome. I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend in augest and we were both delighted with the hotel. The rooms were small but comfortable and had an ensuite bathroom and mini bar. It also had great central heating and was in a very quiet area. The breakfast was good, plenty cereals and bread and you could also order a prepacked breakfast to pick up the next morning if you were planning an early start. The hotel is situated right beside a bus stop which will take you everywhere in the city and is very cheap ! This was fantastic for us as we never had to use the metro ! The staff were also really friendly and had great english and were very willing to advise us on the sights, where to go and what number bus was correct ! There is a small bar in the hotel but there is a great bar and pizza place near the hotel and also a large supermarket ! Overall, was delighted with this hotel and it is the perfect base for a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: glim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2008 and it was a decent clean hotel. The closest metro stop isn't actually that close, you're better off taking the bus, look for the ones that go on Nomentana street (esp. if you have luggage). We took metro on arrival and it was a pain dragging our luggage up/down stairs on metro than wheeling it at least 5-6 blocks up hill to the hotel. The Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was basics: cereals, yogurt, cold meats, cheese, rolls, coffee, juice, water, fruits. Location was good. The chinese restaurant across the street was decent and very affordable. Cons: The Air condition was turned off in the building because the weather is suppose to be cold in November, but for the couple days we were there it was warmer than usual so we had to keep the windows open otherwise it felt like a sauna at times. If you get a room on the 6th floor, the elevator only goes up to the 5th floor. The rate they charge for internet usage is a little high, if you hop on the bus and go down to cavour street there is an internet shop that's cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a taste of Rome”
Reviews.Author: dogwalkerKent
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here. Being on the outskirts but on the 60 bus route and close to Bologna Metro meant that we could get our bearings as we rode into the Centre, but could relax out of the hustle and bustle if we wanted to in the evenings. The bus dropped us at the Vittoria Emanuel monument, Piazza Venezia. Via Nazionale or Coliseum, all close to other well known sites. We were also able to use the bus to start tours out of the City to Ostia Antica and Via Appia Antica. The hotel staff was helpful and polite. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the breakfast was generally good. One niggle is that there was no facility to make a warm drink in the room at night. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: SuFoo
Reviews.Content: Santa Costanza (Rome) was good value for money for our family of 2 adults and 2 teenage children. Being only 20 minutes by bus to the city centre (Piazza Venezia), its location was better than we expected. Besides, it is surrounded by a few rather decent restaurants, as recommended by the hotel's competent and helpful receptionist. The guest rooms were clean, well equipped and tastefully furnished. It would have been perfect if we could get two adjacent rooms during our 3-night stay. But still, we would definitely recommend our friends to stay at this property should they visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pilotcoupleBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Not very central but good value, clean rooms with helpful staff. Need to get metro to attractions 500 m from hotel. Not many restaurants near by. Breakfast basic with orange cordial and not juice. Rooms on the front noisy ask for ones at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad location, double check your reservation”
Reviews.Author: CountryHopper
Reviews.Content: I almost always book my flights and hotels, separately and directly. However, having decided on Rome, I found that the flight prices on easyjet had doubled and so I turned to Lastminute.com for a 'deal'. After hours of searching we decided on Hotel Costanza, three stars etc., the location seemed central and tube connections nearby. We flew in to Champino airport and met our pre-booked transfer (average cost of transfers £35 each way, we paid £90 for both to ensure a good service and booked in advance). The transfer time was around half an hour. Arriving at the hotel around 6pm, we were told there was 'big problem' we never really got to understand why, but we were told we would have to be transferred for the first night to an equivalent hotel. We were only there for three nights so packing and unpacking for one night was a nuisance. However the hotel agreed that a taxi would take us to our new hotel and collect us at 9am the following morning to drop our bags back at Costanza. The 'equivalent hotel' was okay but not as nice, no mini bar for cold drinks, no aircon, further from the tube and the room was much smaller but it was clean and dry so we go on with it. The following morning we waited patiently for the taxi, but none arrived and after half an hour we had to walk back to the original hotel. They apologised and we left our bags while we went exploring and they prepared the room. On the plus side, they allowed us to park our hired mopeds in their car park free of charge and left a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room. The location was good, a 10 minute walk down the long Via Aprille XXi road to the Bologna stop of the tube. Breakfast was reasonable - good by european standards and the staff were as helpful as could be with directions reservations etc. The room which ws apparently one of the better ones to compensate for our trouble, was large and clean but the bath plug didn't work so we couldn't soak after a long day sightseeing. The room was fully airconditioned and impeccably clean. Decent restauirants nearby and if you hire a moped everything is within 5 - 10 minutes ride. I would definitely stay here again, but I would book direct as I'm convinced the problem with our room was a double booking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - wear your walking shoes!”
Reviews.Author: MissWright36
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August 2007. It is a small hotel but the rooms were clean and had powerful air conditioning - a bonus in 40 degree temperatures. The rooms have a mini bar, TV and an en-suite bathroom. Our room did not have a balcony and we only used the hotel to sleep in as the rooms were pretty small. The hotel is technically within walking distance of the sights but the walk will take you about an hour! Much quicker to use public transport. Don't attempt to walk from the Termini station either - get a taxi! I really enjoyed my time in Rome and I would recommend this hotel as a base camp - fine for sleeping but not much in the way of entertainment. And use the subway to get into the centre of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Eurotrip417
Reviews.Content: I have to thank Hotels.com I didn't reserve my hotel weeks ahead of time, but I was still able to find a reasonable hotel that was in a good location. The Santa Costanza was great and I enjoyed the location. We stayed there for two nights. After touring Rome we were able to return to a comfortable room. This was a trip of a lifetime for my son. I will stay here again. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: goolio
Reviews.Content: Very clean, well kept room, if you're not used to Italian hotels you will find it small. Breakfast adequate, staff cordial rather than out and out friendly. Once you get used to the fact that the whole of Rome is covered in grafftiti, you will realise this is actually in quite a nice neighborhood. The bus stop immediately to the left of the hotel is useful for a bus down to the Metro station at Bologna. However, across the main road to your left (the Via Nomentana), you can get an express trolleybus (no.90) to the Termini Station where there are numerous connections to other bus routes and the Metro. Buy a 'Biglietto Turistico Integrato' - 11 Euros for three days unlimited travel on public transport. We ate at two pizzerias about ten minutes walk across the Via Nomentana both, confusingly, called Pizzeria San Marino. The one to the left is cheaper and friendlier. You can take a table on the pavement (well, in the road, actually!). Rome is a very tiring, slightly chaotic but dazzling city. Don't be put off by reports of street crime, but do take sensible precautions with your valuables. I would also recommend visiting early or late in the year, as the heat even in June can be draining. A tip for visiting the Vatican - take the Metro one stop to Policlinico, then tram no.19 which takes a very pleasant route through the North of the city and terminates right by the Vatican's walls.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: susanmary8
Reviews.Content: if you want a good hotel for a good price in rome - this hotel is the one for you.it is not right in the centre of rome but is a good stroll to the bologna metro and lots of buses go from out side of the hotel .just round the corner you can get the 60 express bus to the coleseum or the 90 to termini station. the hotel is nicley decorated and the reception helpful.our room was a good size with ensuite and was clean with a comfy bed.we had a balcony which was nice.it was double glazed so we did not hear noises from the street.the breakfast was continental but with a good choice of food.coffee and english tea. we liked being slightly out of rome and walked to a paizza just passed santa constanza square were we sat with the locals drinking italian lager. tip for the colleseum. if you buy a ticket for the palatine hill this also gives you entry into the colleseum.after you have been through security you can walk past the long queue to buying a ticket if you join a tour offered outside make sure you can enter through the guided tours section which also misses the queue.english tours can be bought in the coleseum for 3 euros or you can use the electronic guide.t

Reviews.Title: “Santa Constanza”
Reviews.Author: anon86
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here for her birthday treat in Dec 06. Excellent hotel, would recommend to any one. Excellent quality/finish more like 4 star, very clean, and staff were very friendly. Buffet breakfast was great, good start to the day. We were really lucky with the weather sun shone for our 5 day stay. One down side was the tarffic noise, if it gets to much for you to sleep then ear plugs can be bought from the local phamacy. The hotel is slightly outdside of the main centre, but the metro or bus was a short ride and is cheap. I took this hotel as it was on special offer, as long as you dont mind riding the metro or bus into the centre then its fab. Also there is a great Italian restaurant 2 mins walk, only seemed to be used by the Italians, was excellent, also a chinese restaurant opposite, just in case you dont eat in the Piazzas. Great base for seeing all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hopewirral
Reviews.Content: I booked the short break for my husbands 40th the hotel santa constanza was lovely very clean and great reception staff . If we were to go back to Rome i would go back to this hotel. It was nice to come away from the city of an evening the station is only 10 minutes walk away and the under ground is so easy to use you can get you bus tickets or train tickets over the road at the kiosk.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowd”
Reviews.Author: TJCountyDown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days for my birthday with my boyfriend in January. I had read mixed reviews about the hotel but was very pleased. The hotel is a good 10 minute walk from the Bologna metro if you are carrying heavy luggage. The hotel is outside the centre of Rome, but the public transport system is so easy to use. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel, and a bus will take you straight down to the Termini station. A tip would be to purchase a travel ticket for 3 or 4 days, which can be used on buses and the metro for the duration of your stay. We found the tourist bus tour was a good way to see the main sights and get your bearings. If travelling in the winter, check the opening times of museums. We found that the Vatican Museum closes half day when we visisted, so had to make another trip. Definitely worth seeing though. We usually ate out in the city, but there are a few restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, including the San Marino pizzeria, which attracts the locals. We stuck to drinking carafes of local wine, as beer was expensive. There was always a good selection at the continental breakfast every morning in the hotel and this was served until 11am. Our room was clean and comfortable and after a busy day walking around Rome, that's all anyone needs. It was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre and everything was only a short bus/metro ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: avva
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from five days in the Santa Costanza Rome. We took a party of four A level students and were delighted. The Hotel is clean, comfortable, yes a bit too warm but we put the green outer metal blinds down and opened our patio doors and were fine. Staff are realy helpful and plesant. Breakfast very good indeed plenty of choice and loads to eat. Situation good too, just 6 mins from the Bolonga Metro and the bus stops outside. We used the supermarket down the street for bread, water, and had a picnic on the balcony day one in sunshine. We stayed on the 5th floor the views from 505-507 are lovely and 508 has a huge corner balcony perfect for spring or summer picnics. The Constanza is a great base to see all of Rome from and is in a good area. We ate one night at the chinese across the road, not as good as the one near the spanish steps but not expensive, cozy family run. Beware of kind men who try to help you buy metro tickets at the Termini they keep the change, ask for a tip and buy a dearer ticket for you. You need the Big 3 day one in the middle of the machine. do take a trip to Ancient Osica, go to pyrimide station and catch the local train from there use your Rome Metro ticket and see the most amazing Roman town from the ancient world with miles of mosaics, a real find. We will go back again and use this hotel because its so good and great value for money too. One last tip go to the gelatia Palma near the pantheon 100 +flavours of ice cream !! bellisimo. The hotel was better than one I stayed in and paid lots more for so ignore the negative comments, some people you cannot please and enjoy Rome for less in comfort

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: merricas
Reviews.Content: Just spent the best weekend ever in Rome, a birthday present from my fiance. Some of the reviews on this hotel I feel are a little unfair, in this beautiful city how much time would you really be spending in your hotel room? having got a really good deal for a two night stay, I read the reviews on this website and was a little apprehensive, this was not at all necessary, in my opinion you should be far too busy taking in all that the"eternal city" has to offer to even notice any bad points about your hotel, we left after a more than satisfactory continental breakfast (especially the lemon croissants) and did not return again until around midnight so exhausted we would have slept on a clothes line. Our room was more than acceptable, very clean and all the amenities you would expect of a three star hotel. (i agree with the comments "if you want 5* accomodation then pay 5* prices) We found the info regarding trains and metros to the hotel (posted on this site)more than useful so thanks to those people. We had nothing at all to complain about regarding this hotel, the location is just out of the actual centre of Rome but it is not that far out that it is difficult to get to, it is three stops from Termini on the metro (we timed our journey from the metro station near "the Spanish steps" back to our hotel and including changing from line A to line B, it took less than 10 mins)or we got the number 60 express bus into the centre (turn left out of the hotel and cross the main road and catch the bus at the stop just to your left), on the Saturday night we actually strolled back to our hotel, this took approx 1hr (sounds mad but we actully saw so much more than being on any transport). We are planning to return to Rome next year and tkae my 8yr old daughterand i will have no hesitation in booking this hotel again or recommending it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pinkbelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel 22nd to 24th October, following a cruise. We arrived by private transfer at 10.00am, and although our allocated room wasn't ready they made some changes so we could get into a room straight away, this was very welcome as we had only had 2 hours sleep the previous night. The room was small, but had everything we needed and was very clean, which is our first priority. I had booked the hotel after reading about it on tripadvisor, i liked the idea of it being out of the centre of Rome but was a little aprehensive of using the public transport. I needn't have been it was very quick cheap and easy. The staff could not have been more helpful, we told them where we wanted to go and they gave us a map with the route marked by bus numbers. A tour company also picks up and drops off from the hotel which is very convenient when you are tired. Breakfast was also very good, we will stay here again, the only thing that stopped us rating it excellent was we found the room too hot and as the air con was central we could not adjust it.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: third
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite ok, clean and the staff is nice. The locks on the doors is a joke and the maid will not always lock your door, be sure to get a key to the room safe for your valuables. Also, in my room there was no power plug at the desk. There was only one availible by the bed. Not good if you need to do work on your laptop. The hotel does not have a wireless network either. I must also agree with the comment that said walls are thin. I could hear the person in the next room snoring quietly. You can hear any activity going on in the surrounding rooms. Not always a good thing...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: The_Judge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Santa Costanza from Sunday 24th September to Sunday 1st October and it was most pleasant. The staff were friendly and in particular Carlo, Michael and Antonio. Nothing was too much trouble for any of them. My room (No 409) was clean although it was a bit on the small side (only 1 bed in it) with barely room to move about! A bit annoyed at this because I paid a single room supplement even though I was not getting use of a double room. When will they stop penalising the single traveller? Anyway, I soon got used to the small size. The breakfasts were Continental and very good. I took the 310 bus from the hotel to Rome each day and this particular service was excellent... and the bus stop is just outside the hotel which was a great convenience. Gerard

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart-ian
Reviews.Content: We've just returned after four nights at the Santa Costanza and found it very comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English and there was plenty of hot water at peak periods( see other reviews). A couple of little niggles. The only English T.V. was CNN which gets a bit boring after four days and what the hotel calls " local attractions", e.g. the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain are a 15 minute express bus ride away. They are extending the Metro line to right where the hotel is but it could be 2010 before it's ready.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: morweena
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, lovely rooms, good location, although you have to get the underground to the center which only takes a few mins, we felt it was better as nice clean quiet area, some nice bars local, and hotel staff friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ventureruk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon for 7 nights. We were apprehensive having read some of the negative reviews on here; however, I can truthfully say I was pleasantly surprised! This hotel has been well renovated to a high standard. Our room had a king size bed, laminate floor and very well presented plus a good bathroom (shower, wc, bidet, sink, lots of towels) and all marble tiles and flooring! Breakfast was very nice and well stocked throughout the morning (we went at a few different times of the morning to see if the quality was as high and selection so plentiful). Staff were very friendly - check in, breakfast room, housekeeping etc and all very knowledgeable of the area. It is located just down the road from Piazza Bologna, approx 5 – 10 min walk from Bologna metro station and three stops away from Termini. All very handy for getting quick access to line A and other central attractions. Overall, was extremely pleased with this hotel and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Agree-worth a try!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Santa Constanza from 4/21-4/25. The best breakfast we experienced while in Italy! The best bed we slept in. Yes it is a bit far out but is outside the crush of downtown Rome and is in a nice neighborhood. Easy to take the 310 to Termini or easier to walk to the Bologna Metro stop (about 10 minutes away) to Termini or stay on for the Blue line. The 60 and 64 busline is easy to catch on Nomentana and there are bancomats close by. There is a nice super market down the street. The dinner at the San Marino pizza restaurant was great and the best gelato is just down the street in Trieste. Will come back for my next stay in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “No hot water!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day break in Rome. The hotel's hot water system apparently can't cope with all the guests using the hot water at the same time i.e. in the morning and before dinner in the evening. Two mornings during our stay nothing would come out of the hot tap at all! The manager was very apologetic but could only suggest we wait until later in the day - which was frustrating as we wanted to join the queues for the Vatican museums. Other than that fairly standard 3 star hotel. A little way out but with excellent public transport links to the centre. The 310 bus takes you directly to Termini from outside the door of the hotel. Just round the corner there is the 90 express bus to/from Termini. Fantastic pizza restaurant a short walk/ bus ride away - the San Marino - ask the hotel receptionists for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Picky American Girl”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel! Like any American girl I reserve the right to be picky and unreasonable… it’s my birth right! This was my first trip to Rome and I was clueless as to where to stay. I took a chance on this hotel after reading a review here on Trip Advisor, and I am glad I did this hotel is located in a safe area. A few blocks up the street you will find a metro station where you can catch a train to any of the major attractions, the walk really isn’t at all bad and there are even a few places to stop for Gelato on the way. There is a pharmacy next to the hotel; and within ½ a block a full grocery and a semi-trendy watering hole with a nice patio perfect for cocktails after a long day of sightseeing. The rooms are smallish (for American standards) but very clean, if you are lucky enough to get a balcony it’s really not bad. Breakfast was a bit too basic but there are plenty of restaurant in the immediate area you can easily walk to. The staff is very helpful and friendly as well. For the price, this was a great place to stay!-MV

Reviews.Title: “Excellent three star - shame about the location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent three star hotel: the public rooms and the bedrooms are of a high standard, well furnished and very clean. The staff are very helpful and the quality of the breakfast is fine for this level of hotel - overall one of the best 3 stars I have stayed at in Europe. The location I found a drawback: yes, there are two bus services within metres of the hotel - direct into town (the 60) or a number of buses, just outside, that will take you to the Metro at Bologna. The bus trips themselves can be long and uncomfortable and waits can be lengthy coming back late at night but it is not an impossible location from this point of view. The Chinese restaurant opposite is excellent value although I found few other places nearby worth a visit - perhaps I should have asked the staff at the hotel for some guidance here! The location is the only aspect that would lead me to have second thoughts about staying here again. The hotel itself is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Best littlle gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mugwumpians
Reviews.Content: If you don't want the noise, dirt, and thieves around the Termini Station and you can't afford the 4 star joints take a very close look at the Santa Costanza. Bus 90 (an express) runs every 10 minutes or so and drops you off on the corner of XXI Aprile just a few meters from the hotel). Bus 60 also runs you down to the Forum et al. Anyway, once inside you'll be impressed with the fine comfortable lobby, bar, interior design and the very spacious and lovely rooms. I suggest rooms in the back, preferably the larger corner rooms which are quiet , well lit, and larger than some others. The front rooms are very nice but tend to be noisy with the street traffic in the day. The Staff is the best I've EVER seen in Rome. Very friendly, polite, knowedgeable about the area, multilingual, and will help you with anything you need. Excellent housekeepers, spotless rooms. A charming breakfast room (although you non-Italians need to ask for capuchino from the white-jacketed waiter or be stuck with the terrible junk in the decanter, er, don't forget to leave him a time when you check out, about 1-2 Euro a day is nice for him and the housekeepers too). It does take 20 minutes to get downtown on the bus but generally you get a seat. The subway station is Bologna but is about 20 minutes walk to the hotel; but not bad without luggage. A grocery store down the street, newstand with English papers on the corner, a cool Lebanese restaurant (take a left before the grocery and bear right when the street splits). Lots of little places to eat at night. We booked early in low season and paid around 100Euros a night. Worth every cent. Would stay again. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel staff and above average breakfast. Our room was on the first floor next to the breakfast lounge, but still noise was not a huge problem. Clean bathroom. Above all bus stop is just 10 meters away. Day or night, transportation is no problem at all. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: juls-and-di
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend and family stayed at this hotel on the 25th November for 3 nights, the hotel was very nice, but we did have a few problems!.. The electric blind fell from the ceiling in our room and nearly 'knocked' my partner out! When we explained the situation to the hotel receptionist we were rudely told that we were liable!obviously we weren't, and after a few tears we managed to sort the problem out!...apart from that the hotel was good, the breakfast is continental,but enough variety to keep you going, and the location was good- a bit out of the city but the bus stop is just up the road and the buses run every 10 mins. There is a lovely chinese restaurant opposite-which is exceptionally good value for money and there is a supermarket at the end of the road.I would stay at that hotel again, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel/Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading other reviews here on this website. The hotel was spotless. The staff was very helpful. The room was good-size with a small balcony and the bed was large. The hotel is located out from city centre, but the busline is right out the door. We loved that section of Rome. This area had wonderful restaurants and shops. Anyone looking for an exceptional value in Rome, we would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely best place so far”
Reviews.Author: crazy87
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took our Mum for her 70th Birthday for 4 night's and we had a lovely time. We even took her to have mass with the Pope!! We stayed at a hotel called Hotel Santa Costanza who could not have done enough for us. We were slightly out of town about 5 mins on the bus but we were quite glad as Rome is so loud car horns, going all the time. Would go again tomorrow not sure if I would take me mum again though!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about this hotel we were a little worried about what the hotel would be like when we arrived. The welcome on arrival was excellent, the receptionist spoke perfect english without asking we were given a map of the city and told were we could catch the bus into the city- very helpful. The bus stop is just around the corner and the service is frequent. There is also a metro station down the road from the hotel, which i would recommend to most. From the metro station (bolgna) you keep on the same road as the vialle xxi apprile exit and can not miss the hotel, it is about 5-10 minute walk, which we did not find too hard even with a heavy suitcase. Although if you do struggle walking generally a taxi may be useful or getting on the bus. Location rise I think it is an excellent choice, away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre but definitely close enough to get to all the sights without too long a journey. The bus takes you to the centre of Rome in less than 10 minutes- if that. The hotel room was nice enough as was the bathroom, although both were not large they were more than adequate. Our room did have air conditioning. The breakfast was nice enough you could eat as much as you want, the ice dusted croisants come highly recommended. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, breakfast is great!”
Reviews.Author: rcmessier73
Reviews.Content: Clean and elegant. Complementary breakfast is surprisingly good. The room I stayed in was pretty small, but at least the interior was nicely furnished. Staff are ok, not exactly helpful but not rude neither. The walk from Bologna Metro Station could be a bit far, try taking the bus, it'd take you directly to the terminal. The area seemed generally safe, I walked every night from the Metro around midnight and didn't see anything suspicious. One nice thing is that it's away from the tourist trap, you can actually pick up a few snacks from a local and reasonably priced grocery/ drug store down the street. There's also an internet cafe a few blocks from the Metro station and a few local cafes that open late.

Reviews.Title: “spotless”
Reviews.Author: spurgec
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a great choice. we had 2 rooms (1 for parents , 1 for kids). Staff was exceptionally helpful, breakfast was adequate but bland after a couple of days. Rooms were spacious and spotless. Suggest you know the bus routes and system before arriving as it was difficult at first to figure the location versus bus stop. The quicker you learn how to read the route signs the better off you will be when away from hotel trying to get home. Got easier once all figured out. No subway after 930pm to Bologna. all buses routed through termini which was always a bit of a hassle and very busy. very disappointed with the cleanliness of the city itself, alot of graffiti and litter everywhere, luckily hotel was different. very little open on Sunday near the hotel, bit of a ghost town.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome for our 3 month wedding anniversary. I researched deals and thought this hotel looked decent enough. Well, if you want to be in the centre of things, do not choose this hotel. We had to take the metro and walk forever to find the hotel the first night. And when we were hungry at 9pm there were no restaurants open or even around the area, very disappointing! We ended up finding a McDonald's and laughed about our lack of Italian food that first night. The hotel was decent enough, nice lobby and breakfast room with a basic choice of food. Don't be deceived by the pictures of the rooms however. I found our room very small, and while it had a huge balcony to walk out on, we never got to enjoy it because it rained most of the time we were there, which of course can't be blamed on the hotel! But we were kept awake by people from the room above us, hence very thin floors/walls. The other odd thing were these dark green shutters on the windows which you could use to shut out any light from outside, but the annoying thing was the noise it made when you went to close them, and the fact that you could hear people from other rooms closing their shutters too!! Despite the hotel being away from the centre of town, we also heard scooters beeping at each other all night. We went for a nice relaxing holiday but found we did not get much peaceful sleep. If we go back to Rome, we will not stay here again!
